Manifest.name: Demo Plugin
Manifest.description: This plugin demonstrates the capabilities of a Mattermost plugin.

settings_schema.header: Header: Configure your demo plugin settings below
settings_schema.footer: Footer: The code for this demo plugin can be found [here](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-demo)

settings.help_text: The channel to use as part of the demo plugin, created for each team automatically if it does not exist.
The user to use as part of the demo plugin, created automatically if it does not exist.
Select the last name for the demo user
Change the text style of the messages posted by this plugin
Generate a random string that the demo plugin will watch for. If the secret string is mentioned in any channel then the demo plugin will publish a special message.
The message posted by the demo plugin when the secret phrase is detected.
settings.default:
Yay! The random secret string was posted!

Go to the settings page for this plugin in the system console to generate a new random secret.

settings.help_text: Enable or disable the demo plugin to tag a username on every message sent. The username value is set below.
Configure the username to be mentioned by the demo plugin. Must be enabled in the setting above.

settings_schema.header:
The GitHub plugin for Mattermost allows users to Subscribe to notifications, stay up-to-date with reviews, see the status of your pull requests at a glance, and other common GitHub actions - directly from Mattermost.  
 
 Instructions for setup areÂ [available here](https://www.mattermost.com/pl/default-github-plugin#configuration)

settings.help_text: The client ID for the OAuth app registered with GitHub.
The client secret for the OAuth app registered with GitHub.
The webhook secret set in GitHub.
The AES encryption key used to encrypt stored access tokens.
(Optional) Set to lock the plugin to a single GitHub organization.
(Optional) The base URL for using the plugin with a GitHub Enterprise installation. Example: https://github.example.com
(Optional) The upload URL for using the plugin with a GitHub Enterprise installation. This is often the same as your Base URL.

(Optional) Allow the plugin to work with private repositories. When enabled, existing users must reconnect their accounts to gain access to private repositories. Affected users will be notified by the plugin once private repositories are enabled.

settings_schema.footer: * To report an issue, make a suggestion or a contribution, [check the repository](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-github).

Manifest.name: Autolink
Manifest.description: Automatically rewrite text matching a regular expression into a Markdown link.

settings_schema.header:
Configure this plugin directly in the config.json file. Learn more [in our documentation](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-autolink/blob/master/README.md).

To report an issue, make a suggestion or a contribution, [check the plugin repository](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-autolink).

Manifest.name: Zoom
Manifest.description: Zoom audio and video conferencing plugin for Mattermost 5.2+.

settings.help_text: The URL for a self-hosted private cloud or on-premise Zoom server. For example, https://yourzoom.com. Leave blank if you're using Zoom's vendor-hosted SaaS service.
The API URL for a self-hosted private cloud or on-premise Zoom server. For example, https://api.yourzoom.com/v2. Leave blank if you're using Zoom's vendor-hosted SaaS service.
The API Key generated by Zoom, used to create meetings and pull user data.
The API Secret generated by Zoom for your API key.
The secret used to authenticate the webhook to Mattermost.
settings.regenerate_help_text: Regenerates the secret for the webhook URL endpoint. Regenerating the secret invalidates your existing Zoom plugin.

settings_schema.footer:
Use this webhook URL to set up the Zoom plugin. See [documentation](https://about.mattermost.com/default-zoom-documentation) to learn more.

```https://SITEURL/plugins/zoom/webhook?secret=WEBHOOKSECRET```

settings.display_name: Allow users to attach and create Jira issues in Mattermost
settings.help_text:
When false, users cannot attach and create Jira issues in Mattermost. Does not affect Jira webhook notifications. After changing this setting to false, disable, then re-enable this plugin in **System Console > Plugins > Plugin Management** to reset the plugin state for all users. 
 
 When true, install this plugin to your Jira instance with '/jira installâ to allow users to create and manage issues across Mattermost channels. See [documentation](https://about.mattermost.com/default-jira-plugin-link-application) to learn more.
The secret used to authenticate the webhook to Mattermost.
settings.regenerate_help_text: Regenerates the secret for the webhook URL endpoint. Regenerating the secret invalidates your existing Jira integrations.

settings.display_name: Mattermost Roles Allowed to Edit Jira Subscriptions
settings.help_text: Mattermost users who can subscribe channels to Jira tickets.

options.display_name: Users who can manage channel settings

settings.display_name: Jira Groups Allowed to Edit Jira Subscriptions
settings.help_text: Comma separated list of Group Names. List the Jira user groups who can create subscriptions. If none are specified, any Jira user can create a subscription.

settings_schema.footer: Use this webhook URL format to [configure the Jira integration.](https://about.mattermost.com/default-jira-plugin)  `https://SITEURL/plugins/jira/api/v2/webhook?secret=WEBHOOKSECRET`

Manifest.name: Autotranslate
Manifest.description: Autotranslate plugin for Mattermost 5.4 and later.

settings.help_text: The access key ID from AWS
The secret access key from AWS
The region from AWS
If set the plugin will reject posts containing profanity instead of censoring.

The character(s) to use to censor profanity. Censored words' letters will be replaced with this character. Note that markdown will be interpreted. You can escape markdown character with a backslash. For using * you type \*.

Manifest.name: Welcome Bot
Manifest.description: This plugin adds a WelcomeBot that helps add new users to channels.

settings_schema.header:
Configure this plugin directly in the config.json file. Learn more [in our documentation](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-welcomebot/blob/master/README.md).

To report an issue, make a suggestion or a contribution, [check the plugin repository](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-welcomebot)
To report an issue, make a suggestion or a contribution, or fork your own version of the plugin, [check the repository](https://github.com/waseem18/mattermost-plugin-jenkins).

settings.help_text: The URL for your Jenkins instance. Must start with http:// or https://. For example: https://jenkins.example.com.
The AES encryption key used to encrypt stored access tokens.

Manifest.name: Antivirus
Manifest.description: Antivirus plugin for scanning uploaded files.

settings.help_text: The hostname and port to connect to clamd
How long the virus scan can take before giving up.

Manifest.name: Walltime Plugin
Manifest.description: This plugin converts the dates/times in messages to the recipient's local timezone.

settings_schema.header: No configuration is needed to use the Walltime plugin.
settings_schema.footer: Made with â¤ï¸ from Mattermost, Inc.

Manifest.name: Custom User Attributes
Manifest.description: Add custom user attributes to the Mattermost user profile popover.

settings_schema.header:
Configure this plugin directly in the config.json file. Learn more [in our documentation](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-custom-attributes/blob/master/README.md).

To report an issue, make a suggestion or a contribution, [check the plugin repository](https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-plugin-custom-attributes).

Manifest.name: Skype for Business
Manifest.description: Skype for Business plugin for Mattermost 5.2+.

settings.help_text: The product type of your Skype for Business instance.
Username of your selected bot account. We strongly recommend using a dedicated bot account for this plugin, rather than an existing user account. Only required for Skype for Business Server.
Password of your selected bot account. Only required for Skype for Business Server.
The domain of your Skype for Business server instance. For example, contoso.com. Only required for Skype for Business Server.

Application ID from the Azure Active Directory. Only required for Skype for Business Online.

Use this URL to configure the plugin in Azure Active Directory: ```https://SITEURL/plugins/skype4business/api/v1/auth_redirect```

settings_schema.footer: To report an issue, make a suggestion or a contribution, [check the repository](https://github.com/kosgrz/mattermost-plugin-skype4business).

Manifest.name: AWS SNS
Manifest.description: Send alert notifications from Amazon AWS CloudWatch to Mattermost channels via AWS SNS.

settings_schema.header: This plugin is used to receive alert notifications from [Amazon AWS CloudWatch](https://aws.amazon.com/cloudwatch/) to Mattermost channels via AWS SNS.

settings.help_text:
The channel to send notifications to, specified in the format `teamname,channelname`. If the specified channel does not exist, the plugin will create the channel for you.
 
Note: Must be the team and channel handle used in the URL. For example, in the following URL, set the value to `myteam,mychannel`: https://example.com/myteam/channels/mychannel

List of users authorized to accept AWS SNS subscriptions to a Mattermost channel. Must be a comma-separated list of user ID's.
 
Tip: Use the [mattermost user search](https://mattermost.com/pl/cli-mattermost-user-search) CLI command to determine a user ID.
Select the username that this integration is attached to.
Generated token to validate incoming requests from AWS SNS.

settings_schema.header: To set up the GitLab plugin, you need to register a GitLab OAuth app here https://gitlab.com/profile/applications.

settings.help_text: The base URL for using the plugin with a GitLab installation. Examples: https://gitlab.com or https://gitlab.example.com
The client ID for the OAuth app registered with GitLab.
The client secret for the OAuth app registered with GitLab.
The webhook secret set in GitLab.
The AES encryption key used to encrypt stored access tokens.
(Optional) Set to lock the plugin to a single GitLab group.
(Optional) Allow the plugin to work with private repositories.

settings_schema.footer: To report an issue, make a suggestion or a contribution, [check the repository](https://github.com/manland/mattermost-plugin-gitlab).

Manifest.name: User Satisfaction Surveys
Manifest.description: This plugin sends quarterly user satisfaction surveys to gather feedback and help improve Mattermost.

settings_schema.header: Mattermost sends user satisfaction surveys to gather feedback and improve product quality. [Learn more](!https://mattermost.com/pl/default-nps) about user satisfaction surveys.

settings.help_text: When true, a [user satisfaction survey](!https://mattermost.com/pl/default-nps) will be sent to all users quarterly. The survey results will be used by Mattermost, Inc. to improve the quality and user experience of the product. Please refer to our [privacy policy](!https://about.mattermost.com/default-privacy-policy) for more information on the collection and use of information received through our services.
